intro: Sticherus flagellaris subsp. tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly sticherus, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Restionaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. This subspecies is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it is found in specific ecological niches.
